attributes.action: We need more military personnel at least 500K to give use the security we need.
attributes.background: The UK has a strong but small army, we achieve many goals like defeating terrorist groups but with an army the size of just under 200,000 its hard to achieve all our goals. The recent issues of immigrants coming into the country just proves how much our border's are not protected completely.
attributes.additional_details:
This link shows our armed forces amount in the RAF, NAVY and ARMY, take a look you might be surprised.

http://www.globalfirepower.com/country-military-strength-detail.asp?country_id=united-kingdom

Many smaller countries have armies much bigger then ours and that says something. All the hard work of the British empire has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Asian governments to stop the inhumane act of shark finning.
attributes.background: Shark numbers are declining due to shark finning - this is when a live shark is taken out of the ocean to have its fin cut off and then thrown back into the water. A shark needs its fin to swim and ultimately to survive. Without it the shark soon dies as it can no longer fend for itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year an estimated 100-200 million sharks are caught for their fins, which often go into the Asian delicacy 'fin soup'. Sharks have been populating our oceans since before the dinosaurs and we can't lose them now. Sharks also play a crucial role in the ecosystem of the ocean by eating sick and dead animals and keeping the seas healthy. By saving sharks we save the oceans and the planet. Shark finning has no place in our modern world and must stop before we lose this ancient species forever.

attributes.action: Early diagnosis for children with autism. Help afterwards.
attributes.background: 'Postcode' lottery for early diagnosis. No help once a diagnosis is made depending where you live.

attributes.action: Working families choice of 30hr funding at age 3 or 15hrs at 3 and 15 at 2
attributes.background: To give working families the choice of whether they want the 30hrs chilcare funding from the age of 3 in 2017 or if they want to split it so they get 15hrs from the age of 2 and 15hrs from the age of 3 has this would benefit alot of families more then the 30hrs from the age of 3.

attributes.action: Bring back sibling enrolment at schools.
attributes.background: The government need to rethink the enrolment of children into schools. They have lost a common sense approach and as of this year are forcing parents to accept their ridiculous decisions on school placements.
attributes.additional_details:
As of now if you have at least one child in a primary school and you apply for the September start for a younger sibling, the government can now ignore common sense and force you to be at 2 different schools at exactly the same time.
They need to bring get back the old "sibling" question into the application for a school place so parents are not put through so much mental stress facing the prospect of having to be on opposite sides of a town at the same time.

attributes.action: Introduce better regulation for Online & Print Media
attributes.background:
The public rely heavily on media to inform them of the news and make many decisions based on it. It is often biased, incites hate and manipulates people.

This is often evident by reading a number of newspapers, all of which have conflicting articles against each other.

attributes.action: Invoke The Treaty of Windsor to protect Portuguese in the UK and vice versa
attributes.background: In the spirit of mutual assistance contained within the “Anglo Portuguese Alliance” and with recent post Brexit extremist goading non UK citizens to leave I propose UK give special protection and rights to Portuguese within the UK  and the same protection be afforded to UK citizens in Portugal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of Windsor has been invoked by the UK on a numbers of occasions to protect the UK including two world wars & the Falklands campaign 
Treaty text of the extant alliance guaranteeing assistance refers: "the ally shall be bound to give aid and succour to the other, so far as he is able (without any deceit, fraud, or pretence) to the extent required by the danger to his ally’s realms, lands, domains, and subjects; and he shall be firmly bound by these present alliances to do this”

attributes.action: Form a National Unity negotiation team to immediately start negotiating with EU.
attributes.background: Post EU vote there is a vacuum and high uncertainty. We want to rapidly see the roadmap to clarity and then stability. The terms of our exit from the EU will last well beyond the term of this government. Therefore, a negotiating team reflecting many perspectives is required - a National Unity team.
attributes.additional_details: PM has resigned. His replacement's selection will take time. Shadow cabinet is fragmenting reducing the effective opposition. Scotland, N.Ireland and the young are bitter about the result. The break-up of the UK is a possibility. Markets are jittery. Now is the time for National Unity. Form our EU negotiation team quickly start the herculian task ahead. It should be led by Leave reflecting the people's will, but must be inclusive to reflect those in our society that feel alienated by the vote.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Terms of a Bill of Rights before Assent to Leave the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum set citizen versus citizen. The EU guaranteed Fundamental Rights. Hillsborough & Stafford show it was left to Citizens to enforce the most basic of Rights - to Life & for Justice. Government & MP's knew but failed - Year after Year. We cannot allowed such rights to be ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU requires a further treaty before Parliament. It should NOT BE passed without the fundamental rights of each UK citizen GUARANTEED first.

Mr Gove's plan is for a BILL OF RIGHTS to abolish the Human Rights Act when most citizens cannot enforce any current rights. 

RIGHTS TO BE TAKEN AWAY should be subject to REFERENDUM before the Act of Leaving. Limit their power to hurt YOU, your Family, & Fellow Citizens. SOVEREIGNTY means the MP is the servant and not the Master

Remind them.

attributes.action:
Brighton out of Britain.
Give Brighton and Hove its independence from Britain.
attributes.background: Brighton and Hove has long been a liberal land at odds with the country it resides in. This has been shown many times in our recent voting past. This has now again been highlighted in the recent brexit vote. We want to remain in Europe and continue to thrive in a time of globalisation.

attributes.action: Delay David Cameron invoking Article 50 to provide more time for EU discussions
attributes.background: 14,400,000 British people voted to REMAIN in the EU. These people cannot be ignored and by delaying David Cameron's invoking of Article 50 this would give the UK time to have more discussion with the EU and possibly come to a mutually beneficial agreement, such as Norway enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
Voting figures taken from the BBC 2016 - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36615028

Information regarding Article 50 taken from The Guardian, 2016 - http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/23/eu-referendum-legally-binding-brexit-lisbon-cameron-sovereign-parliament

attributes.action: Install a shield in the Commons Chamber in memory of Jo Cox MP
attributes.background: Following the sickening murder of Jo Cox MP whilst serving her constituents, Parliament should move to install a shield -like the shield installed for Airey Neave- in the Commons Chamber.

attributes.action: Greater independent regulation and oversight throughout buying a new home
attributes.background: Stressful enough, the process of buying a new house is fraught with legal traps and hidden charges for the consumer, where developers have free-reign to act as they please. Just like the majority of other industries, we need a body to provide advice to consumers and help when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Buyers being forced to queue in the freezing cold overnight for the right to reserve a property should not happen in the 21st Century, and neither should waiting almost a year trapped, having legally exchanged contracts, to move in.

Thanks to schemes like help-to-buy it is getting easier for first time buyers to purchase, and new-build properties are the key. The NHBC is there to help when you've moved in, but we need an independent regulating body to help through the process of purchasing.

attributes.action: End all UK weapons sales to oppressive regimes.
attributes.background: The UK currently sells large quantities of weapons to countries that the Foreign Office recognises as having poor human rights records, including some that have even been accused of war crimes. Profit and political pandering to these regimes should not outweigh basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.amnesty.org.uk/yemen-conflict-uk-must-stop-selling-arms-saudi-arabia

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/britain-still-arming-israel-despite-fear-weapons-will-be-used-against-gaza-10357621.html

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/28/uk-weapons-sold-countries-poor-human-rights-saudi-arabia?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/08/killer-facts-the-scale-of-the-global-arms-trade/

attributes.action: The Government to start an official trial on the safety of e-cig/vape products
attributes.background: I have been a vaper for 6 years and feel much better than when I was a smoker.  I have not even had a cold for 3 years which means no trips to the doctors or prescriptions!!
attributes.additional_details: Although there may be dodgy products on the market...this can equate to dodgy iPhone chargers.  Exploding batteries....ever heard of mobile phones exploding/setting on fire.  E-cigs/vaping products need to be officially tested and for the scare tactics to stop once and for all

attributes.action: MPs should be paid the National Living Wage after regaining control of their pay
attributes.background: Many working people struggle financially on low wages. MPs are currently 'forced' to receive large salaries and pay increases by an independent body.  By reclaiming their right to set their own pay they could set it at the National Living Wage. This would encourage them to work for a fairer society.

attributes.action:
Petition Minister of Health -
Establish Hospice Suites in NHS Hospitals
attributes.background: The current Office of National Statistics survey of End of Life Care, ‘Voices’, shows 96% of the dying strongly prefer home care or some more private and congenial place to die than the wards of a Hospital. Only 3% prefer Hospital yet half of deaths annually in England will occur on the wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospice care is the ‘centre of excellence’ for palliative care but most of us will die on the wards. We could have privacy, dignity and specialised care in Hospice Suites requiring reorganisation rather than more resources to establish.  

A recent Select Committee hearing had an NHS spokesman claiming this provision would reduce the skills of generalist Nurses and Doctors,  as if patients exist only to provide practical experience for medical staff. The dying should enjoy the best we can provide.

attributes.action: Tougher consequences for Domestic Abuse including mental and financial abuse.
attributes.background: Domestic Abuse is looked upon as mostly solely physical abuse in society, and this needs to change. It needs to be made publicly aware that it's more than just physical, including mental and financial. This can impact a victims life as much as phsyical, and should hold a higher sentence for all.
attributes.additional_details: There should be higher consequences for all aspects of domestic abuse including an automatic 2 year restraining order for anyone found guilty of causing Domestic abuse. This will resolve further issues including harassment and stalking preventing further abuse. A domestic Abuse list should be created to protect victims who suffered the abuse. Mental and financial abuse should be thoroughly investigated having the same consequences as phsyical. These consequences should prevent abuse re-occuring

attributes.action: Increase drink driving ban from a minimum of 12 months to a minimum of 24 months
attributes.background: Drink drivers are a bigger threat than terrorists. Some people seem to love taking risks. The majority of the time it's not the drink driver that gets hurt. 3,000 people a year on average are either killed or injured by a drink driver. Take the drink drivers off our streets for longer.

attributes.action: Strip First Group as franchise holders of Great Western Railways
attributes.background: General contempt for passengers' needs and woeful strategy in times of difficulty. Relaxed attitude to cancellations and delays.  Timetable relaxation to suit GWR.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times from Wiltshire are broadly 20% longer and tickets broadly 80% dearer than just over a decade ago.  Car park costs doubled.  Cancellations and delays are frequent. Limited conpensation for season ticket holders and GWR are past masters at making it difficult to claim. General contempt for the people they are supposed to serve.

attributes.action: Support scrapping the 'lesser-duty' rule to save British steel industry.
attributes.background: The government are stating they are exploring all avenues to help the British steel industry. However, they continue to oppose the EU's attemps to remove the 'lesser-duty' rule which would impose higher levys on chinese steel. We ask that the goverenment helps British steel industry and save jobs.

attributes.action: Teach touch typing in schools as part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: In our modern digital world, efficient use of keyboards is an essential life skill. My children have gone through the state school national curriculum in England and never received formal typing instruction. And as a parent, there was nothing I could do about it.
attributes.additional_details:
"It's no good expecting children to be able to produce a document quickly and accurately on a computer without giving them the skills to do it." http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/schools/why-its-cool-to-touch-type-1737511.html
"Touch typing allows us to write... at the speed of thought."
https://www.technologyreview.com/s/425018/out-of-touch-with-typing/
"Almost one third of British employers (30%) say they will not hire someone if they can’t touch type..."
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/ukschools/2014/09/02/new-research-reveals-why-typing-really-does-matter/

attributes.action: Include Menstrual Cups and Reusable Sanitary Towels in Free Prescriptions.
attributes.background: why not prescribe diva/moon/menstrual cups or washable Sanitary Towels to the low income which would be covered under the free prescriptions right? it would be cheaper in the long run for the government and the diva cup is a lot more beneficial for your health.
attributes.additional_details:
A food bank has started a campaign urging the government to make tampons free after women confessed to using old socks, handkerchiefs, and even scrunched-up newspapers instead. - Fiona Rutherford Buzzfeed news.
“Most women confessed to regularly getting infections resulting in prescriptions for antibiotics and in some cases hospital treatment,” - Major Colin Bradshaw
#beggingforaTAMPON

attributes.action: Make the term "Engineer" a legally protected designation.
attributes.background: Engineering as a profession is popularly confused in the UK with such occupations as plumbers, mechanics and fitters. This gives it both a lower status than it deserves and an unwarranted gender bias. This results in the UK having the lowest proportion of females in engineering in the whole OECD.
attributes.additional_details:
There is already a severe shortage of graduate-level engineers and this is predicted to worsen. Many people are put off engineering at school, either because they (or their teachers) do not see it as a career for the academically gifted. In most of the developed world, it has a status closer to that of medicine and a correspondingly higher participation rate of females, ~30%, vs 7% in the UK.  

IPPR 2014: Women in Engineering (2014)
Professor John Perkins' Review of Engineering Skills (2013)

attributes.action: The Government should make contingency plans for an EU Referendum Leave vote.
attributes.background: H.M. Govt., like all responsible organisations, needs to look into the future and produce contingency plans for all potential outcomes which would significantly change the status quo, and which have a high probability of coming about. e.g.How will we get the best Trade Deal and Curtail Immigration?
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister has stated that, in the event of a Leave vote, he would want to stay in office to negotiate the best deal for Britain. It would be an abdication of his responsibilities for him to not start planning for this outcome now. There are many areas that need to be considered e.g. trade deals with non-EU countries, examination of EU rules and directives and their formal incorporation into UK law or abandonment, the recovery of our fisheries, UK subsidies to farming, etc.

attributes.action: Give the Meningitis B vaccine up to the age of 18!
attributes.background: I myself had meningitis B at the age of 18. So it is not just babies and young children that can get it. I thought I had been vaccined for meningitis at the age of 11 in primary school but it was meningitis C, so I believe all ages should also be given the meningitis B vaccine.

attributes.action: £15 an hour and travel time for all carers
attributes.background: Some employees could be working an extra 10 hours a week once travelling time is counted..
attributes.additional_details: 7am to 10pm and we get paid a wage that we can't even live on. But if we don't care for the elderly.. Who's going to because most of them don't have family around them. Being a Carer is very rewarding but the pay and no paid travel time is horrendous. Mileage is not enough.

attributes.action: Replace regular public bins with recycle on the go bins throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Currently it is very difficult to recycle whilst out and about in public and it makes sense to add recycling bins onto the regular small black bins you see in the street. Scotland has rolled out 'recycle on the go' bins and the rest of the UK should too!

attributes.action: Put up the age for learner drivers from 17 to  21.
attributes.background: Stop learner drivers applying for lessons at the age of 17 to 21 has there are more accedents with youngsters these days with boy racing and drink driving and 17 years of age you are only still a child.

attributes.action: The state should purchase the M6 Toll Motorway and remove the tolls.
attributes.background:
The current private owners of the M6 Toll motorway have put the motorway up for sale. The road has never made a profit, loosing an average of £25M per year (source BBC).
The M6 Toll motorway is a vastly under-used national resource, which would be better added to the national state owned road stock

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: GAIN 'CONSUMER RIGHTS' REGARDING 'OVER PHONE' CONTRACTS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES.
attributes.background: l purchased a small pub 2 years ago to save from closure. When agreeing a Sports package over the phone I realised the next day this was not what I required. After immediate calls, letter and emails I was told I have no 14 day cooling off period, I could not cancel, and had to pay for a full year.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not have the infrastructure of large companies and cannot have resources to cover all areas for contracts, accountancy, and legal complications. Specifically regarding contracts agreed over the phone where the seller could not possibly deliver all the rules and regulations of a contract, there should be 14 days allowed to consider an agreement in full. Presently an 'over the phone agreement' is irreversible and binding. Equivalence of consumer rights for Small Businesses.

attributes.action: Change to the Lifetime ISA rules (re: transferring from Help to Buy ISA)
attributes.background:
Allow Help to Buy savers who have 
- saved for over a year and 
- are going to transfer their savings into the Lifetime ISA on 06/04/2017 in order to purchase a home at over the £250,000 cap
be able to purchase a home at any point once the Lifetime ISA is open rather than wait another year.
attributes.additional_details:
"those who already have a Help to Buy: ISA will be able to transfer these funds into a Lifetime ISA and receive the government bonus on those savings...In line with the normal Lifetime ISA rules, Help to Buy: ISA savers will be able to purchase a first home with the government bonus 12 months from the date of opening their Lifetime ISA."

Source: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/508176/Lifetime_ISA_final.pdf [Accessed 31/07/2016]

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for disabled toilets to be used as storage
attributes.background:
In the news 18th July 2016 eurostar were using disabled toilets for push bikes , this is not unusual in the few months I've found two pubs I'm my local area using their disabled toilet as storage for high chairs .
Disabled toilets are for easy access  not storage.
attributes.additional_details: Eurostar storing bikes in disabled toilets - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36820751

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Hold a Final EU Referendum
attributes.background:
A vote to Leave the EU on 23/6 was a false choice, for the terms of exit were unknown. Hold a Final EU Referendum giving electors a vote (transferable to second preference) from three clear choices:

• Leave with control of EU immigration
• Leave with EU single market access
• Remain in EU
attributes.additional_details:
The terms of a potential UK exit from the EU had not been addressed at the time of the 23 June 2016 referendum. Consequently, many who voted to Leave were not aware that the UK would have to choose between control of immigration from the EU and continued access to the EU single market. Leave voters are entitled to full disclosure of the necessary abandonment of one or the other of these core Leave aims. 

The electorate should be given the chance to express first and second  preferences from three choices: the two Leave alternatives and to Remain. Votes for the least favoured alternative would be transferred to second preferences.

This Final EU Referendum would provide the fairest and most democratic expression of public will to the government to guide its negotiations with the EU.

attributes.action: A General Election or another EU Referendum
attributes.background: Considering the very misleading campaign to leave the EU, the fallout we have witnessed since the now obviously flawed results and the fact that nobody in power seems to be acknowledging these issues, we the undersigned demand that the fixed term rules of Parliament be put aside and call an election
attributes.additional_details: If Parliament are not willing to allow a general election at this volatile and very confusing time, then at least pay attention to the facts surrounding the EU Referendum, that the results were largely due to flawed campaigns, lies and manipulations.  Many people, an estimated 7% according to one survey would vote differently 'now they know' the facts.  A referendum should not be actioned on results garnered through false information and scare tactics.  Election, or another referendum is needed.

attributes.action: The Queen should be asked to stop Art 50 being invoked because of the referendum
attributes.background: In the light of the threat to the integrity of her United Kingdom and the narrowness of the vote, Members of Parliament should request that Her Majesty the Queen use the powers invested in her to ensure that Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty is not invoked on the basis of the June 23rd referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
The narrow victory for Leave in the recent referendum, and the likelihood that initiating Article 50 will lead to the break-up of the United Kingdom, leave the UK in a very difficult position. Political parties are in chaos. 
The Queen has the power to stabilise the United Kingdom and it would help if she were advised to do so by Parliament.

attributes.action: Compulsory educational visits to The battle of the Somme and Churchill's bunkers
attributes.background: I feel that children have very little knowledge about the sacrifices soldiers made for our country and why we should always take time to remember them as a mark of respect. It should become part of the curriculum for history and geography.

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: Article 50 must be invoked within12 mths following the result of the referendum.
attributes.background: David Cameron has not invoked article 50. In order to stop this or a future government from not respecting the result of the referendum and the wishes of the people of the UK, there must be a rule that Article 50 must be invoked within 12 months of the result of the referendum.
